title: Rotational kinetic energy - spinning wheel release

content.question:
In a demonstration, a teacher holds the axle of a wheel that is spinning with constant angular speed. The teacher then releases the axle and the wheel begins to fall toward the ground. As the wheel falls, its angular speed remains constant. Which of the following correctly describes how the rotational kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub rotational" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>rot</mi></msub></math> of the wheel and the total kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub total" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>tot</mi></msub></math> of the wheel change, if at all, after the wheel is released but before it reaches the ground?
<math alttext="K sub rotational" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>rot</mi></msub></math><math alttext="K sub total" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>tot</mi></msub></math>AConstantConstantBConstantIncreasingCIncreasingConstantDIncreasingIncreasing
